title: How to Turn Off Message Notifications on an iPhone

steps.title: Open Settings from your home screen.
steps.content: Open Settings from your home screen.

steps.title: Toggle “Allow Notifications” to the left.
steps.content: Toggle “Allow Notifications” to the left. This is done by tapping the green slider on the right and will turn off all Message notifications.

steps.title: Toggle off "Show in Notification Center".
steps.content: Toggle off "Show in Notification Center". This will disable Message notifications from showing up in the center when you access it by swiping down from the top of the screen.

steps.title: Toggle off "Badge App Icon".
steps.content: Toggle off "Badge App Icon". Doing so will disable the notification that pops up next to the app's icon on your home screen.

steps.title: Toggle off "Show on Lock Screen".
steps.content: Toggle off "Show on Lock Screen". Doing so will disable notifications from popping up on the lock screen while your phone is not in use.

steps.title: Select an alert tone.
steps.content: Select an alert tone. This is done by tapping on the tone you want to use for notifications. Tapping on the various tones will give you a preview.

steps.title: Select a vibration by tapping on it.
steps.content: Select a vibration by tapping on it.

steps.title: Tap on Sounds.
steps.content: Tap on Sounds . It’s located at the top-left corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap on Messages.
steps.content: Tap on Messages . Doing so will bring you back to the Messages notifications page where you can make more modifications.
